item.title: China to persist with AI development in 2024 despite rigid US chip restrictions, UBS analysts say
item.description:
English Summary：

Despite US export controls restricting China's access to advanced semiconductors, China plans to proceed with developing large language models (LLMs) and generative AI systems. China aims to achieve progress within these constraints by utilizing domestic AI accelerator programs and optimizing computing resource usage. Nicolas Gaudois from UBS emphasizes China's resilience in overcoming setbacks and highlights the growth of China's semiconductor sector in unsanctioned segments. Randy Abrams from UBS notes the increasing market share of local semiconductor equipment suppliers and opportunities in mature application areas. The global demand for chips is expected to rise as inventory pressures ease and procurement at semiconductor foundries improves.
  • Abstract: China to push ahead with AI development despite US export controls.
  • Theme: China's determination to advance its AI capabilities amidst US restrictions.
  • Viewpoint: China's ability to overcome challenges and its focus on domestic resources and optimization.
  • Main information: China's plans for AI development, domestic AI accelerator programs, growth in unsanctioned semiconductor segments, and rising demand for chips.

中文总结：

在受到美国出口管制限制无法获得先进半导体的情况下，中国预计将继续发展大型语言模型（LLM）和生成式人工智能（AI）系统。中国将利用国内人工智能加速器项目和更经济地使用计算资源，在这些限制条件下取得进展。瑞士信贷亚太区科技研究主管 Nicolas Gaudois 强调了中国在克服挫折方面的弹性，并强调了中国半导体行业在未受制裁细分市场中的增长。瑞士信贷台湾研究主管 Randy Abrams 指出，本地半导体设备供应商的市场份额不断增加，在成熟应用领域中存在机会。随着库存压力缓解和半导体代工厂采购情况改善，全球对芯片的需求预计将增长。
  • 摘要：中国将推进人工智能发展，尽管受到美国出口管制。
  • 主题：中国在面临美国限制的情况下，决心推进其人工智能能力。
  • 观点：中国克服挑战的能力，以及其对国内资源和优化利用的关注。
  • 主要信息：中国的人工智能发展计划、国内人工智能加速器计划、未受制裁半导体领域的增长和对芯片日益增长的需求。

单词：

  • resilience (n.) - /rɪˈzɪliəns/ 弹性，韧性。

    原文例句：Gaudois said US export controls have blocked China’s access to Nvidia chips used for AI projects, but indicated that the mainland’s ability to overcome such setbacks must not be underestimated.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由re-（再）和salire（跳）组成，意为“恢复原来的形状”。在这个例句中，它指的是中国在面临美国出口管制时，能够克服挫折并保持前进的能力，即弹性。

  • Semiconductor (n.) - /ˌsemiːkənˈdʌktə/ 半导体。

    原文例句：UBS analysts asserted that China’s semiconductor sector has developed well in certain unsanctioned segments, showing strong market growth over the past few years.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由semi-（半）和conductor（导体）组成，意为“半导体”。在这个例句中，它指的是中国半导体行业在某些未受制裁的细分市场中发展良好，表现出强劲的市场增长。

词组：

  • within those constraints - 在那些限制范围内。

    原文例句：China is expected to “work within those constraints and try to make progress” by tapping into domestic AI accelerator programmes and being more economical in using computing resources, said Nicolas Gaudois, head of Asia-Pacific technology research at UBS.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由within（在里面），those（那些），constraints（限制）组成，表示“在那些限制范围内”。在这个例句中，它表示中国预计将“在那些限制范围内工作并努力取得进展”。

  • overcome setbacks - 克服挫折。

    原文例句：The country’s ability to overcome setbacks caused by US exports controls must not be underestimated, according to UBS’ Nicolas Gaudois.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由overcome（克服），setbacks（挫折）组成，表示“克服挫折”。在这个例句中，它表示中国的政府应该重视克服挫折的能力，尤其是在受到美国出口管制的影响时。

句子：

  • China will press ahead this year with development of large language models (LLMs) – the technology used to train ChatGPT and similar applications – and generative artificial intelligence (AI) systems, despite restrictions imposed by the United States on the mainland’s access to advanced semiconductors, according to analysts from Swiss investment bank UBS. - 中国将在今年继续发展大型语言模型（LLM）——用于训练 ChatGPT 和类似应用程序的技术——和生成式人工智能 (AI) 系统，尽管美国对内地获取先进半导体施加了限制，瑞士投资银行 UBS 的分析师表示。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是China will press ahead this year with development of large language models (LLMs)，其中主语是China，谓语是will press ahead，宾语是development of large language models (LLMs)。despite restrictions imposed by the United States on the mainland’s access to advanced semiconductors是一个介词短语作状语，修饰主句，表示尽管美国对内地获取先进半导体施加了限制。according to analysts from Swiss investment bank UBS是一个介词短语作状语，修饰主句，表示根据瑞士投资银行 UBS 的分析师的说法。这个句子的意思是说，尽管美国对内地获取先进半导体施加了限制，中国将在今年继续发展大型语言模型（LLM）——用于训练 ChatGPT 和类似应用程序的技术——和生成式人工智能 (AI) 系统，瑞士投资银行 UBS 的分析师表示。

语法：

  • 主谓一致 - 主语和谓语在人称和数上要一致。

    原文例句：UBS analysts asserted that China’s semiconductor sector has developed well in certain unsanctioned segments, showing strong market growth over the past few years.

    语法讲解：这是一个主谓一致的例子，主语是UBS analysts，谓语是asserted。asserted是assert的过去分词，assert是一个不及物动词，不需要宾语。在这个例句中，UBS analysts和asserted在人称和数上都是一致的，都是第三人称单数。

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：China has been making iPhones and other products in India for several years, including the latest iPhone 15.

    语法讲解：这是一种时态，结构是：have/has + been + 现在分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，it表示这家公司从过去的几年开始一直在印度生产iPhone和其他产品，直到现在仍在进行。

  • China is expected to ‘work within those constraints’ while making progress via AI accelerators and more economical use of computing resources
  • The country’s ability to overcome setbacks caused by US exports controls must not be underestimated, according to UBS’ Nicolas Gaudois

China will press ahead this year with development of large language models (LLMs) – the technology used to train ChatGPT and similar applications – and generative artificial intelligence (AI) systems, despite restrictions imposed by the United States on the mainland’s access to advanced semiconductors, according to analysts from Swiss investment bank UBS.

China is expected to “work within those constraints and try to make progress” by tapping into domestic AI accelerator programmes and being more economical in using computing resources, said Nicolas Gaudois, head of Asia-Pacific technology research at UBS, during a webinar hosted by the bank on Tuesday.

Gaudois said US export controls have blocked China’s access to Nvidia chips used for AI projects, but indicated that the mainland’s ability to overcome such setbacks must not be underestimated.

The views expressed by UBS analysts reflect how China’s semiconductor industry weathered last year’s escalation of Washington’s tech sanctions, which restricted exports of advanced chip-making equipment and cutting-edge semiconductors for AI projects.

The mainland’s tech sector appeared to have overcome the chokehold of US export controls last year, when Huawei Technologies made a surprise return to the 5G smartphone market with new handsets powered by a “breakthrough” advanced made-in-China processor.

It showed the lengths taken by the US-blacklisted company to build up its operations, following years of struggles on account of trade sanctions.

Apart from that breakthrough, UBS analysts asserted that China’s semiconductor sector has developed well in certain unsanctioned segments, showing strong market growth over the past few years.

“Restrictions from the US are very limited on mature nodes,” said Randy Abrams, head of Taiwan Research at UBS, in the same webinar on Tuesday. He pointed out that sales of these mature-node chips have not been restricted.

“We have seen China make more effort to invest in those areas,” Abrams said. “We will see steady market pickup in mature applications, such as camera image sensors, micro-controllers, analogue chips and discrete semiconductor devices for EVs.”

China’s semiconductor industry weathers tough year amid tighter US sanctions

“In semiconductor equipment, local suppliers have built up their market share from very low single-digits into the mid- to high-single-digits,” he said. “Their gains come from supplying China semiconductor manufacturers, as they’ve added mature node capacity.”

Abrams said domestic chip-making equipment suppliers saw their market share increase to about 20 per cent on the back of demand from Chinese chip fabrication facilities. “So if we leave out the very advanced nodes, there are actually a lot of [investment] opportunities,” he said.

Global demand for chips, he said, is expected to start picking up, as soon as inventory pressures ease and procurement at semiconductor foundries improves.

A slew of sanctions imposed by the US since 2019 has also forced companies across China’s vast tech supply chain to work closely together.

Internet search giant Baidu, which runs Ernie Bot and the Ernie LLM, ordered US$61 million worth of Huawei’s 910B Ascend AI chips – which the Chinese firm developed as an alternative to Nvidia’s A100 processor – for 200 servers, according to a report in November by Reuters, which cited sources.

item.title: Alibaba’s DingTalk updates workplace collaboration app with new AI agent amid growing client demand
item.description:
Summary：

阿里巴巴的钉钉推出更新版本的工作协同应用，增加了AI智能助手功能，帮助用户精简和定制工作流程。该公司在杭州举行发布会宣布了这一消息，称AI智能助手功能旨在解决70多万公司客户的反馈。
  • Abstract: Alibaba's DingTalk releases an updated version with AI agent function.
  • Theme: DingTalk's AI agent aims to streamline workflow and address user feedback.
  • Viewpoint: The role of AI agents in improving productivity and user experience in workplace collaboration apps.
  • Main information: DingTalk 7.5 launch, AI agent feature, feedback from corporate clients, AI-generated content trend, low entry barriers for AI agent platform.

总结：

在杭州举行的一次公司活动中，阿里巴巴集团控股的钉钉发布了其工作场所协同应用程序的更新版本，增加了人工智能 (AI) 代理功能，以帮助用户简化和定制他们的工作流程。这一开发正值人工智能领域的一片繁忙景象之际，中国各公司争相将类 ChatGPT 服务纳入其产品中，字节跳动旗下竞争对手飞书也采取了类似举措。阿里巴巴拥有南华早报。钉钉总裁叶军在一份声明中表示，在浙江省东部省会杭州举行的一场公司活动上宣布的钉钉 7.5 随附的 AI 代理功能旨在解决从 70 多万企业客户中收集的反馈。该公司称，这项新工具有望推动 AI 产品在行业中的更广泛采用。“随着 AI 生成的内容浪潮日益融入生产力和 [商业] 用例，AI 代理已成为 AI 应用最合适的门户，”叶军说。
  • 摘要：阿里巴巴钉钉发布更新版本，新增AI智能助手功能。
  • 主题：钉钉的AI智能助手旨在简化工作流程并解决用户反馈。
  • 观点：AI智能助手在提高工作场所协同应用的生产力和用户体验中的作用。
  • 主要信息：钉钉7.5发布，AI智能助手功能，企业客户反馈，AI生成内容趋势，AI智能助手平台的低进入门槛。

单词：

  • streamline (v.) - /ˈstriːmlaɪn/ 简化，精简。

    原文例句：The AI agent feature was announced alongside DingTalk 7.5 at a corporate event held in Hangzhou.

    例句讲解：这个单词源于stream（流）和line（线），意为“使成流线型，使更有效率”。在这个例句中，它指的是AI智能助手功能旨在使工作流程更有效率。

  • customization (n.) - /kʌstəmaɪˈzeɪʃən/ 定制，个性化。

    原文例句：The AI agent feature was announced alongside DingTalk 7.5 at a corporate event held in Hangzhou.

    例句讲解：这个单词源于custom（习俗，习惯）和-ization（使……化），意为“定制，使适合个人需求”。在这个例句中，它指的是AI智能助手功能旨在使工作流程更适合个人需求。

词组：

  • on entry - 在入口处。

    原文例句： Shoes and apparel giant Belle International has rolled out a customized AI agent on its DingTalk platform to track parcel shipment issues, with plans to expand the use of the agent to more cases, including stock allocation.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由on（在……上）和entry（入口，进入）构成的，表示“在入口处”。在这个例句中，它表示鞋服巨头百丽国际在其钉钉平台上推出了一个定制的AI代理，以跟踪包裹发货问题，并计划将该代理的使用范围扩展到更多案例，包括库存分配。

  • take by storm - 使惊讶，震惊。

    原文例句：LLMs are the deep learning models, pre-trained on vast amounts of data, that underpin chatbots such as OpenAI’s ChatGPT, which took the world by storm a year ago with its ability to understand complex questions and respond with human-like text.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由take（拿，带）和storm（暴风雨）构成的，表示“使惊讶，震惊”。在这个例句中，它表示LLM是经过大量数据预训练的深度学习模型，它们是类似OpenAI的ChatGPT这样的聊天机器人的基础，ChatGPT一年前以其理解复杂问题并以类人文本进行回应的能力震惊了世界。

句子：

  • At the launch of Feishu 7, ByteDance introduced an AI bot dubbed Feishu Intelligent Buddy, which can help users with daily tasks such as drafting emails, drawing up spreadsheets and summarising long reports.- 在飞书7的发布会上，字节跳动推出了一款名为飞书智能助理的AI机器人，可以帮助用户完成日常任务，如起草电子邮件、绘制电子表格和总结长篇报告。

    句子分析：这是一个复杂句，主句是ByteDance introduced an AI bot dubbed Feishu Intelligent Buddy，其中主语是ByteDance，谓语是introduced，宾语是an AI bot dubbed Feishu Intelligent Buddy。At the launch of Feishu 7是一个介词短语作状语，修饰ByteDance introduced an AI bot dubbed Feishu Intelligent Buddy，表示在飞书7的发布会上。which can help users with daily tasks such as drafting emails, drawing up spreadsheets and summarising long reports是一个定语从句，修饰an AI bot dubbed Feishu Intelligent Buddy，表示这款AI机器人可以帮助用户完成日常任务，如起草电子邮件、绘制电子表格和总结长篇报告。这个句子的意思是说，在飞书7的发布会上，字节跳动推出了一款名为飞书智能助理的AI机器人，可以帮助用户完成日常任务，如起草电子邮件、绘制电子表格和总结长篇报告。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在或已经完成的动作或状态。

    原文例句：The development comes amid a flurry of activity in the AI sector as Chinese companies rush to incorporate ChatGPT-like services into their products and after a similar move by ByteDance’s rival app Feishu.

    语法讲解：这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。结构是：have/has + been + 现在分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。在这个例句中，The development comes amid a flurry of activity in the AI sector as Chinese companies rush to incorporate ChatGPT-like services into their products and after a similar move by ByteDance’s rival app Feishu.，表示一项发展正值中国公司纷纷将类似ChatGPT的服务纳入其产品的活动热潮中，以及字节跳动旗下竞争对手飞书采取类似举措之后。

  • DingTalk’s AI agent function is powered by Alibaba’sTongyi Qianwen large language model
  • The AI agent feature was announced alongside DingTalk 7.5 at a corporate event held in Hangzhou

Alibaba Group Holding’s DingTalk launched an updated version of its workplace collaboration app on Tuesday with the addition of an artificial intelligence (AI) agent function to help users streamline and customise their workflow.

The development comes amid a flurry of activity in the AI sector as Chinese companies rush to incorporate ChatGPT-like services into their products and after a similar move by ByteDance’s rival app Feishu. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.

The AI agent feature announced alongside DingTalk 7.5 at a corporate event held in Hangzhou, capital of eastern Zhejiang province, is designed to address feedback gleaned from more than 700,000 corporate clients, said Ye Jun, president of DingTalk, in a statement.

The new tool is expected to promote greater adoption of AI products in the industry, according to the company.

“As the tide of AI-generated content increasingly finds its way into productivity and [business] use cases, AI agents have emerged as the most suitable gateway for AI applications,” said Ye.

ByteDance brings AI to office tool Feishu, taking on Tencent and Alibaba

Ye added that DingTalk’s goal is to become an AI agent platform with low entry barriers, with the marketplace expected to grow substantially in the next three years.

As of the end of 2023, Dingtalk had over 700 million users. It also has 25 million organisations, including corporate and educational institutions that use its platform, of which 120,000 are paying clients, said Ye.

Shoes and apparel giant Belle International has rolled out a customised AI agent on its DingTalk platform to track parcel shipment issues, with plans to expand the use of the agent to more cases, including stock allocation.

DingTalk’s addition of an AI agent function, powered by the group’s Tongyi Qianwen large language model (LLM), comes after ByteDance’s Feishu made a similar push last November.

LLMs are the deep learning models, pre-trained on vast amounts of data, that underpin chatbots such as OpenAI’s ChatGPT, which took the world by storm a year ago with its ability to understand complex questions and respond with human-like text.

At the launch of Feishu 7, ByteDance introduced an AI bot dubbed Feishu Intelligent Buddy, which can help users with daily tasks such as drafting emails, drawing up spreadsheets and summarising long reports.

Feishu also announced a platform to enable its corporate clients to build and customise AI bots according to business needs, it said at the time.

After a year of hype over AI chatbots, Chinese Big Tech firms including Alibaba, ByteDance and Baidu have been rushing to build competitor products to ChatGPT, with applications spanning the finance, legal, manufacturing, retail and public sectors.

item.title: Alibaba’s logistics arm Cainiao offers shoppers in US grouped delivery service, cutting shipping times to five days
item.description:
Summary：

Chinese logistics company Cainiao has introduced a new consolidated shipping service in the US, allowing consumers to combine multiple online purchases from different platforms and deliver them in as little as five days by air or at a reduced cost by sea.
  • Abstract: Cainiao's consolidated shipping service simplifies cross-border deliveries for Chinese consumers in the US, offering faster and cost-effective options.
  • Theme: Cainiao's expansion of its services to cater to the needs of Chinese consumers in the US and support e-commerce growth.
  • Viewpoint: The growing demand for cross-border e-commerce and the importance of efficient logistics solutions for overseas consumers.
  • Main information: Cainiao's consolidated shipping service, covering both air and sea routes, provides faster delivery times and cost savings; the service is initially targeting Chinese consumers in the US; Cainiao plans to raise $1 billion through a listing in Hong Kong.

总结：

中国物流公司菜鸟在美国推出了一项新的综合运输服务，允许消费者将来自不同平台的多个网上购物订单合并，并通过空运在五天内交货，或通过海运以更低的成本交货。
  • 摘要：菜鸟的综合运输服务简化了中国消费者在美国的跨境交货，提供了更快、更具成本效益的选择。
  • 主题：菜鸟扩展服务以满足中国消费者在美国的需求并支持电子商务增长。
  • 观点：对跨境电子商务需求的增长以及海外消费者对高效物流解决方案的需求。
  • 主要信息：菜鸟的综合运输服务，涵盖空运和海运，提供更快的交货时间和节省成本；该服务最初针对美国中国消费者；菜鸟计划通过在香港上市筹集 10 亿美元。

单词：

  • consolidated (adj.) - /kənˈsɑːlɪdeɪtɪd/ 合并的，统一的。

    原文例句：The so-called “consolidated shipping” service, covering both air and sea transport routes, will collect multiple online shopping orders placed by users on various platforms in a warehouse before shipping them from China.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由con-（共同）和solidus（坚固）组成，意为“使坚固，使统一”。在这个例句中，它指的是一种综合运输服务，将用户在不同平台上下的多个在线购物订单收集到一个仓库，然后从中国发货。

  • parcel (n.) - /ˈpɑːrsəl/ 包裹，包裹物。

    原文例句：If the parcel is sent via air, delivery times may be reduced five days after the items are sent out from the warehouse.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Old French，由par（通过）和cel（this）组成，意为“通过这个传递的东西”。在这个例句中，它指的是一个包裹，如果通过空运发送，包裹的交货时间可能会在从仓库发出后五天内减少。

  • revenue (n.) - /ˈrevənjuː/ 收入，收益。

    原文例句：In the third quarter of 2023, Best’s global businesses achieved revenue of US$37.7 million, contributing to 12.4 per cent of the total.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Old French，由revenir（回来）和nue（新）组成，意为“重新开始，重新获得”。在这个例句中，它指的是收入，即通过商业活动获得的收益，在这个例子中，Best在2023年第三季度的全球业务收入为3770万美元，占总收入的12.4%。

词组：

  • cross-border e-commerce - 跨境电子商务。

    原文例句：Cainiao has its eye on the overseas market, and recorded more than 1.5 billion cross-border e-commerce parcel deliveries in its recent financial year to March, making it one of the world’s top logistics services providers, according to its prospectus.

    例句讲解：这个词组由cross-border（跨境）和e-commerce（电子商务）组成，意为“跨境电子商务”。在这个例句中，它指的是一种通过互联网进行的跨国界商品交易活动，通常涉及消费者和企业之间的商品交易。

  • subject to market conditions - 取决于市场状况。

    原文例句：Cainiao aims to raise at least US$1 billion, subject to market conditions, according to a Post report in September that cited people familiar with the situation.

    例句讲解：这个词组由subject to（取决于）和market conditions（市场状况）组成，意为“取决于市场状况”。在这个例句中，它指的是菜鸟的筹资目标取决于市场状况，即市场状况将影响菜鸟能够筹集到的资金数量。

句子：

  • The company has been making iPhones and other products in India for several years, including the latest iPhone 15. - 该公司一直在印度生产 iPhone 和其他产品数年，包括最新的 iPhone 15。

    句子分析：这是一个现在完成进行时态的句子，主语是The company，谓语是has been making，其中has been是be动词的现在完成时态，making是动词make的-ing形式。这个句子表示该公司的动作或状态从过去的某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个句子中，它表示该公司一直在印度生产iPhone和其他产品，直到现在仍在进行，并且包括最新的iPhone 15。

语法：

  • 助动词will的用法 - 表示将来时态。

    原文例句：Cainiao said the cross-border shipping service would mainly help Chinese consumers and students in the US who tend to buy lots of goods on Chinese e-commerce sites.

    语法讲解：will是助动词，用在动词前面，表示将来时态。在肯定句中，will与动词原形连用；在否定句和疑问句中，will与动词原形的否定式连用。在这个例句中，will与动词help连用，表示菜鸟所说的跨境运输服务将主要帮助那些经常在中国电商网站上购买大量商品的中国消费者和学生。

  • Cainiao said cross-border shipping service would mainly help Chinese consumers in US who tend to buy lots of goods on Chinese sites
  • The so-called ‘consolidated shipping’ service covers both air and sea transport routes

Cainiao, Alibaba Group Holding’s logistics unit, will open a new service for consumers in the US to allow them to package several items they have bought together, cutting delivery times to as little as five days.

Cainiao said in a statement on Tuesday that the cross-border shipping service would mainly help Chinese consumers and students in the US who tend to buy lots of goods on Chinese e-commerce sites. As of 2020, there were roughly 60 million Chinese living outside the country, according to a report by Huaqiao University.

If the parcel is sent via air, delivery times may be reduced five days after the items are sent out from the warehouse. If by sea, the new service may cut the cost to as low as 12 yuan (US$1.7), depending on the size of the parcel, according to the statement.

The new overseas service comes ahead of Cainiao’s planned US$1 billion listing in Hong Kong. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.

Alibaba’s AliExpress, PDD-owned Temu face supply chain challenges in South Korea

The so-called “consolidated shipping” service, covering both air and sea transport routes, will collect multiple online shopping orders placed by users on various platforms in a warehouse before shipping them from China.

Prior to its US expansion, Cainiao provided consolidated shipping to shoppers in other markets outside mainland China, including Hong Kong, Singapore and Australia.

In November, Cainiao and Alibaba were part of a consortium that made a US$57 million offer to buy Chinese logistics company Best. Best is a major courier in China and has a presence in Southeast Asia. In the third quarter of 2023, Best’s global businesses achieved revenue of US$37.7 million, contributing to 12.4 per cent of the total.

Cainiao has its eye on the overseas market, and recorded more than 1.5 billion cross-border e-commerce parcel deliveries in its recent financial year to March, making it one of the world’s top logistics services providers, according to its prospectus.

Cainiao aims to raise at least US$1 billion, subject to market conditions, according to a Post report in September that cited people familiar with the situation. The listing is part of a group-wide restructuring of Alibaba, as the e-commerce titan seeks to free up decision- making amid increased competition.

Established in 2013, Cainiao serves as the logistics backbone of Alibaba’s e-commerce empire, handling more than 4 million cross-border parcels on a daily basis in 2023. Alibaba announced it would spin off Cainiao in the restructuring announced in March.

item.title: CES 2024: China TV makers Hisense and TCL promote AI, live sports at US show

Summary：

  • Chinese television manufacturers Hisense and TCL showcased their latest product lineups at CES 2024, emphasizing AI (Artificial Intelligence) and smart home integration.
  • Both brands positioned themselves as leading Chinese contenders in the US television market, highlighting their in-house technology production and supply chain capabilities.
  • Mini-LED technology and affordable high-quality TVs were major talking points, with Hisense offering mini-LEDs integrated into all its models.
  • AI-powered image processing and enhancement featured prominently, with both Hisense and TCL utilizing AI chips to optimize picture quality based on content type.
  • Beyond TVs, TCL and Hisense also showcased augmented reality (AR) glasses and virtual reality (VR) headsets.
  • Hisense highlighted its foray into the automotive sector, developing AR displays for car windshields and aiming to connect home appliances with car infotainment systems.

总结：

  • 中国电视制造商海信和TCL在2024年国际消费类电子产品展览会（CES）上展示了他们的最新产品阵容，强调人工智能 (AI) 和智能家居集成。
  • 这两个品牌都将自己定位为美国电视市场领先的中国竞争者，突出它们的内部技术生产和供应链能力。
  • Mini-LED 技术和价格实惠的高质量电视是主要卖点，海信提供集成到所有型号中的 Mini-LED。
  • 人工智能驱动的图像处理和增强功能尤为突出，海信和 TCL 都利用人工智能芯片根据内容类型优化图像质量。
  • 除了电视外，TCL 和海信还展示了增强现实 (AR) 眼镜和虚拟现实 (VR) 头显。
  • 海信重点介绍了其进军汽车行业，为汽车挡风玻璃开发 AR 显示器，并旨在将家用电器与汽车信息娱乐系统连接起来。

单词：

    例句讲解：供应链是指从原材料采购到产品销售的整个链条，包括生产、运输、仓储、配送等各个环节。在这个例句中，它指的是这两家公司能够在自己内部生产大部分的技术，并且正在将业务扩展到诸如增强现实（AR）等领域。

    • 句子分析：这是一个复杂句，主句是The companies emphasised their ability to produce much of their technology in-house，其中主语是The companies，谓语是emphasised，宾语是their ability to produce much of their technology in-house。how they are branching out into areas like AR是一个宾语从句，其中主语是they，谓语是are branching out，宾语是into areas like AR。这个句子的意思是说，这两家公司强调了他们能够在内部生产大部分技术的能力，以及他们如何进军增强现实等领域。

语法：

  • 分词短语 - 由分词和其修饰语组成的短语。

    原文例句：With an emphasis on artificial intelligence (AI) and making screens the centre of the home, while pushing into new areas like cars.

    语法讲解：这是一个分词短语，由分词making和其修饰语With an emphasis on artificial intelligence (AI) and和the centre of the home组成的。这个短语作状语，修饰主句while pushing into new areas like cars，表示在强调人工智能（AI）和将屏幕作为家庭的中心的同时，也进军汽车等新领域。

  • The two biggest Chinese TV brands offered competing narratives about their global stature and AI processing capabilities
  • The companies emphasised their ability to produce much of their technology in-house and how they are branching out into areas like AR

Chinese television set makers Hisense and TCL unveiled their latest line-ups at CES 2024 in Las Vegas on Monday, with an emphasis on artificial intelligence (AI) and making screens the centre of the home, while pushing into new areas like cars.

Both companies offered competing narratives, presenting themselves as the biggest Chinese brands in the US television space. They also boasted about their supply chain prowess and the ability to manufacture leading technologies in-house.

David Gold, president of Hisense USA, said the company’s ability to produce displays and even its own AI chipsets without third parties is something that sets it apart.

“When you think about global players, I think we are one of less than a handful of companies that have everything that it takes to be able to truly provide a smart home solution,” Gold said after the Hisense presentation. “We have all the ingredients, all the components. There are very few companies out there that can do the same.”

Tech giants Alibaba, ByteDance lead China’s return to CES

The flagship product from Hisense this year is its new 110-inch ULED X television with a brightness of 10,000 nits and 40,000 backlight zones.

Not to be outdone, TCL announced what it said is the world’s largest mini-LED TV at 115 inches. TCL referred to itself as a “great global power” with 32 research and development centres and 43 manufacturing sites around the world.

Mini LEDs featured prominently in the presentations of both Hisense and TCL, as they each presented their brands as the best option for finding this tech in TVs that cost just a few hundred dollars, rather than thousands.

Hisense said that mini LEDs – which cram more LEDs into a display to offer a greater range of contrast and image quality – are now integrated into all its models, including one for under US$500.

Hisense also introduced its new so-called laser TVs, which are projectors combined with an ambient-light-rejecting screen. The company said its newest 8K Sonic Laser TV is the “world’s largest sound-emitting screen”, offering a sound bar-like experience built into the projector. It is also offering a new Rollable Laser TV, which is exactly what it sounds like: a projector screen that rolls up and disappears, offering a cleaner look at home when not in use.

Both companies used sports to draw attention to their new TVs. As more viewers switch to streaming, the focus on live television has largely fallen to sports, a major reason households remain subscribed to cable and satellite TV packages.

TCL leaned into this heavily, inviting sportscasters including Charissa Thompson and former National Football League player Charles Woodson on stage for nearly the entire duration of the presentation.

Hisense highlighted the ability of its AI chips to enhance picture quality by identifying whether the video is coming from streaming, cable or another source.

“[Our AI is] about recognising what content it is, the quality, the factor in which it’s being displayed – whether it’s streaming, cable, DVDs, Blu-ray – and finding the way to enhance that picture quality,” Gold said. “Usually you put in one setting and never change it again. What we’re trying to do with AI is automatically detect, ‘Oh, now you’re watching football, let’s move to a sport setting’.”

Seemingly omnipresent at CES 2024, AI was mentioned repeatedly during both presentations, as it has been by rivals like Samsung and LG.

TCL talked of enhancing access to its AI processing with three levels of its AIPQ processors, which include “pro” and “ultra” versions. The AI processors are now offered in its cheaper S Class series.

While TVs are typically the highlight for these events from the Chinese display giants, they are also chasing other trends in the industry. TCL mentioned the latest version of the RayNeo X2 smart glasses, which can display images on the lenses to do things like offer real-time text translation. TCL incubated RayNeo.

The company also highlighted its newest smartphones and tablets with an emphasis on its Nxtpaper display, which is meant to be easier on the eyes like e-reader displays.

Hisense is working on its own augmented reality (AR) glasses and a virtual reality headset, but both are just prototypes for now.

It has also followed many of its Chinese peers – like Xiaomi and Huawei Technologies – into the auto sector. It is working on bringing its projector technology into cars to, among other things, turn the windscreen into an AR display. The company said this enhances safety because drivers do not need to take their eyes off the road when getting information like navigation.

“If you’re on the road and your smart refrigerator can tell you, ‘hey, you’re out of eggs; so on your way home, stop by and pick up some eggs,’ that’s the idea that we’re going for,” Gold said.

Many tech firms are betting on cars as the next big area of growth. As leaders in electric vehicles, Chinese companies are benefiting from the trend. Carmakers Li Auto, Great Wall Motor, Zeekr and Xiaomi will all use Nvidia’s Drive tech for autonomous driving, the chip firm announced on Monday.

Samsung and Sony also discussed their own partnerships with carmakers in their presentations on Monday. Sony has partnered with Honda on its Afeela joint venture, while Samsung is partnering with Hyundai to bring its SmartThings platform to cars.

item.title: JD.com’s on-demand delivery unit, Dada Nexus, loses 46 per cent of US stock value overnight amid internal inquiry into potential fraud
item.description:
English Summary:

  • Shanghai-based Dada Nexus, an on-demand delivery firm affiliated with JD.com, disclosed questionable revenue and costs amounting to US$140 million in its books during the first three quarters of 2023.
  • The internal audit revealed overstated revenue from online advertising and marketing services and operational costs.
  • Dada Nexus's stock value dropped by 46% in New York following the news, further eroding investor confidence in Chinese tech stocks.
  • Xin Lijun, Dada Nexus's chairman, resigned in December 2023, and Chen Zhaoming, the chief financial officer, also stepped down.
  • The company reported the potential fraud case to local police and is working with third-party agencies to conduct an independent review.
  • Dada Nexus's operations include JD Daojia, JD.com's on-demand retail platform, and Dada Now, which works with brick-and-mortar retailers to fulfill and deliver online orders.

Chinese Summary：

  • 总部位于上海的京东到家关联企业达达集团，在2023年前三季度账目中发现10亿元的可疑收入和成本。
  • 内部审计揭示了在线广告和营销服务收入以及运营成本的夸大。
  • 达达集团的股票价值在纽约下跌46%，进一步侵蚀了投资者对中国科技股的信心。
  • 达达集团董事长新利军于2023年12月辞职，首席财务官陈照明也已离职。

  • 达达集团的业务包括京东到家、京东的按需零售平台和达达快送，后者与实体零售商合作，以履行和交付在线订单。

Words:

  • nexus (n.) - /ˈneksəs/ 联系，连接。

    原文例句：Dada Nexus, which operates JD Daojia and Dada Now, found 1 billion yuan (US$140 million) worth of questionable revenue and costs in its books for the first three quarters of 2023 during a routine internal audit.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由nectere（连接）衍生而来，表示“连接，联系”。在这个例句中，它指的是达达集团，一家经营京东到家和达达快送的按需配送公司。
